message.content:
cs.CY, cs.CR, cs.SE, cs.IT, cs.HC 

The paper discusses the impact of IT-driven innovation on the US economy and the evolving IT industry ecosystem. It also explores the landscape of industry-academic interaction and proposes recommendations for enhancing those interactions. Based on this, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.CY (Computers and Society) as the paper discusses the impact of computing on society and the economy. Other likely sub-categories include cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) as the paper mentions the need for companies to remain agile to respond to market changes driven by new technologies and startups, cs.SE (Software Engineering) as the paper discusses the need for companies to focus on a pipeline or portfolio of technologies that bring immediate value, cs.IT (Information Theory) as the paper discusses the profitability of IT research investments, and cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) as the paper mentions evolving user experience expectations and the demand for new and exciting products.
